Steps.StepString: Accessed the meme generator web application

Substeps.SubstepString: Accessed the meme generator web application.

Steps.StepString: Experimented with the meme generator functionality, noting the server requests

Substeps.SubstepString: Engaged with different features of the meme generator.
Took note of the different server requests that were sent as a result.

Steps.StepString: Observed that the web application uses PhantomJS/2.1.1

Substeps.SubstepString: Identified that the underpinning technology of the web application is PhantomJS/2.1.1.

Steps.StepString: Research about PhantomJS/2.1.1 and identified a known vulnerability (CVE-2019-17221)

Substeps.SubstepString: Found a known vulnerability (CVE-2019-17221) linked with PhantomJS/2.1.1.

Steps.StepString: Used the knowledge of the vulnerability to conclude that the web application potentially parses the HTML content and interpret it, implying a possibility of Cross-site Scripting (XSS)

Substeps.SubstepString: Applied the knowledge of the discovered vulnerability to infer certain characteristics of the web application.
Concluded that the web application may interpret HTML content, thus implying a potential for Cross-site Scripting (XSS).

Steps.StepString: Created an XML HTTP request that references the /etc/flag.txt directory

Substeps.SubstepString: Included a reference to the /etc/flag.txt directory in the request.

Steps.StepString: Injected the crafted payload into a request in either the top text or bottom text

Substeps.SubstepString: Introduced the crafted payload into either the top text or bottom text of a request.

Steps.StepString: Submitted this payload to the meme generator

Substeps.SubstepString: Submitted the request containing the crafted payload to the meme generator.

Steps.StepString: Realised that the generated PDF had the flag inside

Substeps.SubstepString: Discovered that the PDF contains the flag.
